rows.TWO COMPANIES, ONE SYSTEM: WHAT EXISTS
There are two things being built simultaneously. They share a system but raise separately.
COMPANY A: IonWave (and every spinoff like it)
A D2C electrolyte brand. The first DAO spinoff.
Raises from investors who want returns on a specific product.
Everyone in the labor chain gets equity in IonWave.
The Trade (698 tabs) is the operating system for this specific business.
COMPANY B: The Coordination Hedgefund (the DAO infrastructure company)
The system that launches IonWaves.
Raises from investors who want to own the factory, not the product.
The thesis: hedge funds reduced investing to thesis → order → fulfillment.
We do the same for complex coordination. Submit a thesis, the system executes it.
IonWave is the first proof that the system works.
IonWave is the demo. The Coordination Hedgefund is the business.
But IonWave also needs to succeed on its own terms — it's not just a demo, it's a real company
that needs to hit $100K MRR and graduate. The demo only works if the product works.
HOW THEY RELATE
Company A (IonWave) generates:
• Revenue (proves unit economics work)
• Training data (every decision, metric, expert calibration is data for the system)
• Proof (investors in Company B see a live company running on the system)
Company B (Coordination Hedgefund) provides:
• The Trade system (698-tab operating model)
• The labor sequence (VA → CoS → PM → experts → operator)
• The AI interface (Claude as UI for the Trade)
• The governance framework (CM, School Model, semesters, graduation)
• Future: automation, RL environment, Trade parameterization
Each new spinoff (Company A2, A3, A4...) makes Company B more valuable because:
• More training data for automation
• More proof for investors
• More expert calibrations in the Quality Calibration Log
• More operators in the network
• The mad libs problem gets easier with each Trade completed
